down the pipeline," the minister said. Labour claimed the decision to appoint Andy Coulson to such a senior Downing Street post raised questions about David Cameron 's judgment. Ed Miliband , the Labour leader, said: The cloud of allegations surrounding Andy Coulson 's tenure at the News of the World raised real questions about his ability to be at the heart of the Downing Street machine. He's now done the right thing but he should have done it earlier. I think it raises real questions about David Cameron 's judgment that he hung on to Andy Coulson for so long. Downing Street sources dismissed Labour's criticism and insisted the prime minister believed that Andy Coulson 's professionalism in sharpening up the Tories' media operation after his appointment in 2007 vindicated David Cameron 's original decision. In the account, that the Los Angeles Times describes as one about "shifting blame and settling scores", Donald Rumsfeld writes that President Bush never asked him whether invading Iraq was the right course to take. While President Bush and I had many discussions about the war preparations, I do not recall his ever asking me if I thought going to war with Iraq was the right decision, he writes. The President Bush was the one charged with the tough choice to commit US forces. "I did not speculate on the thought process that brought him to his ultimate, necessarily lonely
